lead_paragraph: A veteran Democratic lawmaker was removed from office by a Republican-dominated House on a technicality, giving Republicans the ability to pass revenue-related bills.

byline.original: By RICHARD FAUSSET and ALAN BLINDER

headline.print_headline: Republicans Unseat Mississippi Democrat After Race Ended in Tie
headline.main: Republicans Unseat Mississippi Democrat Who Drew Winning Straw After Race Ended in Tie

snippet: A veteran Democratic lawmaker was removed from office by a Republican-dominated House on a technicality, giving Republicans the ability to pass revenue-related bills.
abstract: Tie for House seat in Mississippi held by Democrat Blaine Eaton II ends in favor of Republican challenger Mark Tullos when Republican lawmakers charge five votes in Eaton's favor should not have been counted; outcome gives Republicans supermajority in Mississippi House; Democrats dispute decision.
